title: The Art of War
author: Sun Tzu
description: Ancient Chinese military treatise on strategy, tactics, and the philosophy of warfare. Essential reading for understanding strategic thinking.

title: The Prince
author: Niccolò Machiavelli
description: Political treatise on power, leadership, and statecraft. Controversial yet insightful analysis of political strategy.

title: Never Split the Difference
author: Chris Voss
description: Former FBI hostage negotiator shares negotiation techniques that apply to business and everyday life.

title: The 36 Strategies
author: Anonymous
description: Ancient Chinese collection of stratagems for politics, war, and civil interaction.

title: Hindu Rashtra Darshan
author: Vinayak Damodar Savarkar
description: Collection of speeches and thoughts by Savarkar on Hindutva and the idea of a Hindu nation.

title: The 1857 War of Independence
author: Vinayak Damodar Savarkar
description: Nationalist reinterpretation of the 1857 uprising as India’s first war of independence.

title: Why I Killed Gandhi
author: Nathuram Godse
description: Godse’s defense statement explaining his motivations behind assassinating Mahatma Gandhi.

title: Bhagavad Gita
author: Vyasa
description: Hindu philosophical text on duty, righteousness, and the nature of reality. Dialogue between Prince Arjuna and Lord Krishna.

title: Upanishads
author: Various Sages
description: Ancient Indian philosophical texts exploring the nature of ultimate reality and the self. Foundation of Vedantic thought.

title: Tao Te Ching
author: Laozi
description: Ancient Chinese classic text of Taoist philosophy, exploring harmony, simplicity, and the way of nature.

title: Water Cures, Drugs Kill
author: F. Batmanghelidj
description: Health guide emphasizing the healing power of proper hydration over pharmaceutical drugs.
